title: how/what to change USBHDD to boot in USBZIP mode

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
Hello,  

I have a USBHDD w/XPPsp2 prepaired and booting USB w/USBoot.  

it boots on several machines but not on my newest desktop system because the bios only supports USBFloppy and USBZip modes.  

how can I make it appear as USB Floppy or USBZip for booting in this desktop but still be able to switch back to USBHDD.  

thanks

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> it boots on several machines but not on my newest desktop system because the bios only supports USBFloppy and USBZip modes.  
>
> how can I make it appear as USB Floppy or USBZip for booting in this desktop but still be able to switch back to USBHDD.
Can you name the specific machine/motherboard, it is VERY strange that a recent motherboard doesn't allow "USBHDD". ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)  

Making it as floppy won't do you any good, as most booting thingies need to be in a HD like device.  

Something you can try is to use the "type B" of Zip like formatting (there are two standards) the one with the MBR:  
[http://www.win.tue.n.../zip/zip-1.html](http://www.win.tue.nl/~aeb/linux/zip/zip-1.html "External link")  
[http://cholla.mmto.o.../linux/zip.html](http://cholla.mmto.org/computers/linux/zip.html "External link")  

More generally, try SEARCHing on the board, often the same question has been asked and (hopefully) answered to:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=5133](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=5133 "External link")  

![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)  
Wonko

So, you give up? ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png) Well, then I will re-state how I don't believe :smile: your initial report: > Can you name the specific machine/motherboard, it is VERY strange that a recent motherboard doesn't allow "USBHDD". :smile: There is NO report in the last, say, 5 years of ANY desktop system missing the boot from HDD option, with the only possible exception of this particular board: [http://www.911cd.net...o...18485\&st=30](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=18485&st=30 "External link") It would be extremely interesting to confirm that today still exist boards without this option. ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png) :smile: Wonko
